PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Betty Jones, 712 Clarissa Street and Carrie Kidd, 3452 Webster Avenue, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 18, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you think that refuse drivers and collectors should be tipped at Christmas time? Is service affected if they are not?" Betty Jones' answer reads: "I don't think that there is anything wrong in tipping, but when the refuse collector begins knocking on the door, I don't think that is necessary.  I haven't found service affected if you do not tip."  Carrie Kidd's answer reads: "I think that the employers should tip.  That's where my husband gets his at Christmas time."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Betty Jones, and Carrie Kidd wearing dark hat with netting, eyeglasses, and light colored short gloves, holding bags, standing in front of wooden wall with "Wallpaper Cleaner" sign and Town Talk bread thermometer
